title: Unable to proceed
header: Sorry, you can’t use the online service
deathCertificate: You need to have the original death certificate or an interim death certificate from the coroner to apply for probate.
notInEnglandOrWales:
You can’t use the online service because the person who died didn’t live in England or Wales or intend to return here.

You will need to apply by post instead. The form you need to fill in depends on whether the person left a will or not.

If the person left a will, fill in the probate application form PA1P.

If the person did not leave a will, fill in the probate application form PA1A.
ihtNotCompleted: You need to complete an inheritance tax form before applying for probate.
noWill:
As the person who died did not leave a will, you will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.

You may also want to check who inherits if someone dies without a will to make sure you are eligible to apply for probate.
notOriginal:
You can’t use the online service if you don’t have the original will of the person who died. You will need to apply by post instead.

If the person left a will, fill in the probate application form PA1P.

If the person did not leave a will, fill in the probate application form PA1A.
notExecutor:
You can’t use the online service if you’re not named as an executor or if you’re applying on behalf of someone else.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1P.
mentalCapacity:
You can’t use the online service as not all executors are able to make their own decisions.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1P.

You will also need to complete a ‘mental capacity form’ for the executor who is unable to make their own decisions.
notDiedAfterOctober2014:
You can’t apply for probate online if the person you’re applying for died before October 2014.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.
notRelated:
You can’t apply for probate online if you’re not the husband, wife, civil partner or child of the person who died.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.
otherApplicants:
You can’t apply for probate online if you want to make a joint application.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.
divorcePlace:
You can’t use the online service if the person who died was divorced outside of England or Wales.

You can apply using the paper form instead. Download the probate application form PA1A, print it out and fill it in.
separationPlace:
You can’t use the online service if the person who died was separated outside of England or Wales.

You can apply using the paper form instead. Download the probate application form PA1A, print it out and fill it in.
otherRelationship:
You can’t use the online service if you’re not the spouse, civil partner or the child of the person who died.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.
adoptionNotEnglandOrWales:
You can’t apply for probate online because the adoption took place outside of England or Wales.

This does not necessarily affect your eligibility to apply for probate, but we may need more information.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.
spouseNotApplying: You can apply using the paper form instead. Download the probate application form PA1A, print it out and fill it in.
childrenUnder18:
You can’t use the online service if there are children under 18 who will receive part of the estate. Children under 18 need to be represented by someone applying on their behalf.

You will need to apply by post instead. Fill in the probate application form PA1A.
